Buses Replace Midday Greenport Trains March 29

To accommodate the installation of new switches in Mattituck and Southold, buses will replace two midday trains between Greenport and Riverhead on Wednesday, March 29. Eastbound customers for the 10:44 AM train from Ronkonkoma will transfer to a bus for service to stations Mattituck, Southold and Greenport. Westbound customers will board buses up to 15 minutes earlier than normal train times for the train departing Greenport at 12:42 PM, Southold at 12:52 PM and Mattituck at 1:05 PM. At Riverhead, customers will connect to train service to points west.

Z Line - Weekday Planned Service Change

All times until Summer 2017 Manhattan-bound Z trains skip 121 St and 104 St, due to station rehabilitation. To these stations, use the nearby 111 St or Woodhaven Blvd stations instead. Or, take the Manhattan-bound J to 111 St or Woodhaven Blvd and transfer to a Jamaica Center-bound J. From these stations, use the nearby 111 St or Woodhaven Blvd stations instead. Or, take the Q56 bus and transfer to/from J service at nearby 111 St or Woodhaven Blvd. Note: Jamaica Center-bound J trains skip 104 St and 121 St from 5:30 PM to 6:30 PM, weekdays; take a Q56 bus or the Z instead.
W Line - Weekday Planned Service Change
10:15 AM to 3 PM, Friday, Mar 31 W trains run every 20 minutes and Astoria-bound trains skip 39 Av, 36 Av, Broadway, and 30 Av, due to structural improvements.
R Line - Weeknight and Weekend Planned Service Changes

Beginning 5 AM, Monday, Mar 27 until Fall 2017 R trains skip 53 St, Brooklyn in both directions, due to station enhancements. To/from this station, use the nearby 45 St or 59 St stations for NR service. Note: N trains stop at 45 St during late night hours only (12:01 AM to 6:30 AM, every day). 11:45 PM to 5 AM, Mon to Fri, Mar 27 - 31 Bay Ridge-bound R trains run express from Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr to 59 St, Brooklyn, due to station enhancements.
N Line - Weekday and Weekend Planned Service Changes

DAYS 9:45 AM to 3 PM, Mon to Fri, Mar 27 - 31 Manhattan-bound N trains are rerouted via the D from Stillwell Av to 36 St, due to track replacement. Trains run express, stopping at Bay 50 St, Bay Pkwy, 62 St-New Utrecht Av, and 9 Av. To 86 St, Avenue U, Kings Hwy, Bay Pkwy, 20 Av, 18 Av, Fort Hamilton Pkwy, and 8 Av, take the Manhattan-bound D or N to New Utrecht Av-62 St or 36 St and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. To 59 St, take the Manhattan-bound D or N to 36 St and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N or Bay Ridge-bound R. From these stations, take a Coney Island-bound N to New Utrecht Av-62 St or Stillwell Av and transfer to a Manhattan-bound N. 10:15 AM to 3 PM, Friday, Mar 31 Astoria-bound N trains skip 39 Av, 36 Av, Broadway, and 30 Av, due to structural improvements. NIGHTS 11:45 PM to 5 AM, Mon to Fri, Mar 27 - 31 Coney Island-bound N trains run express from Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr to 59 St, Brooklyn, due to station enhancements. Beginning 5 AM, Monday, Mar 27 until Fall 2017 N trains skip 53 St, Brooklyn in both directions, due to station enhancements. To/from this station, use the nearby 45 St or 59 St stations for NR service. Note: N trains stop at 45 St during late night hours only (12:01 AM to 6:30 AM, every day). All times until Spring 2017 Astoria-bound N trains skip 86 St, Avenue U, Kings Hwy, 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy, due to station improvements. N trains stop at Bay Pkwy and 8 Av. To 86 St, Avenue U, and Kings Hwy, take the Astoria-bound N to Bay Pkwy and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. To 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy, take the Astoria-bound N to 8 Av and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. Westbound train service from Jamaica to Penn Station and Woodside to Penn Station will be temporarily suspended shortly after 4 PM. As an alternative, NYC Transit will cross-honor LIRR tickets at Jamaica Station for E train subway service to 34th St/Penn Station and at Woodside for #7 line service to 34th Street. Westbound customers may also take the LIRR to Atlantic Terminal in Brooklyn and transfer there for Manhattan-bound 2/3 line service to 34thSt/Penn Station. NYC Transit will also cross-honor LIRR tickets on the E train for westbound customers at subway stations adjacent to the Kew Gardens and Forest Hills stations.

Due to an earlier Amtrak derailment, the LIRR anticipates cancellations and delays from Penn Station during this evening's rush hour. Customers are advised to allow extra travel time. Although the LIRR was able to operate normally during the off-peak hours, four of the nine Penn Station tracks used by the LIRR for the evening rush hour are currently not available for our use as a result of the derailment. With only Tracks 17-21 available to the LIRR, our service capacity from Penn is reduced by almost 50% during tonight's PM Peak. The LIRR will provide normal PM peak service from Atlantic Terminal in Brooklyn and Hunterspoint Avenue. Trains from these terminals normally have some available seating capacity.

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS For approximately three months, the two right "Downtown" exit lanes at the Manhattan plaza of the Queens Midtown Tunnel will be closed for the final stage of exit plaza roadway rehabilitation. Customers traveling Downtown can use the four open and newly resurfaced "Uptown" or "Crosstown" exit lanes, or the left "Downtown" exit lane, which will remain open during this period. In addition, East 37th Street between Tunnel Exit and 2nd Avenue has been temporarily converted to receive two-way traffic, to accommodate motorists exiting the tunnel from the Uptown lanes and seeking a Downtown route via 2nd Avenue.

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS For approximately three months, the two right "Downtown" exit lanes at the Manhattan plaza of the Queens Midtown Tunnel will be closed for the final stage of exit plaza roadway rehabilitation. Customers traveling Downtown can use the four open and newly resurfaced "Uptown" or "Crosstown" exit lanes, or the left "Downtown" exit lane, which will remain open during this period. In addition, East 37th Street between Tunnel Exit and 2nd Avenue has been temporarily converted to receive two-way traffic, to accommodate motorists exiting the tunnel from the Uptown lanes and seeking a Downtown route via 2nd Avenue.

Westbound customers will board buses up to 15 minutes earlier than normal train times for the train departing Greenport at 12:42 PM, Southold at 12:52 PM and Mattituck at 1:05 PM. Buses Replace Midday Greenport Trains March 22 & 29

To accommodate the installation of new switches in Mattituck and Southold, buses will replace two midday trains between Greenport and Riverhead on consecutive Wednesdays, March 22 and March 29. Eastbound customers for the 10:44 AM train from Ronkonkoma will transfer to a bus for service to stations Mattituck, Southold and Greenport. Westbound customers will board buses up to 15 minutes earlier than normal train times for the train departing Greenport at 12:42 PM, Southold at 12:52 PM and Mattituck at 1:05 PM. At Riverhead, customers will connect to train service to points west.

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS For approximately three months, the two right "Downtown" exit lanes at the Manhattan plaza of the Queens Midtown Tunnel will be closed for the final stage of exit plaza roadway rehabilitation. Customers traveling Downtown can use the four open and newly resurfaced "Uptown" or "Crosstown" exit lanes, or the left "Downtown" exit lane, which will remain open during this period. In addition, East 37th Street between Tunnel Exit and 2nd Avenue has been temporarily converted to receive two-way traffic, to accommodate motorists exiting the tunnel from the Uptown lanes and seeking a Downtown route via 2nd Avenue.

New Fares Effective March 19 for New York State Stations

On Sunday, March 19, new fares will go into effect on the Harlem and Hudson Lines, as well as on the New Haven Line for travel between stations in New York State ONLY. Look for the following specific changes: For monthly and weekly commuters, fares will increase by no more than 3.75%. Monthly ticket increases will not exceed $15.00. Intermediate monthly and weekly ticket increases are also capped at 3.75%. Some one-way fares will have larger increases only because fares must occur in 25-cent increments. For these one-way fares, any increase greater than 6 percent would be not more than 50 cents per ride. Monthly/Weekly UniTicket Fares will increase by approximately 4.0%. PLEASE NOTE: The March 19 fare increase does not affect ticket prices for travel between stations in Connecticut and New York, or between stations within Connecticut The MTA's continued discipline in keeping costs down has resulted in the lowest increase since 2009. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/new_fares.html

New Fares Effective March 19 for New York State Stations

On Sunday, March 19, new fares will go into effect on the Harlem and Hudson Lines, as well as on the New Haven Line for travel between stations in New York State ONLY. Look for the following specific changes: For monthly and weekly commuters, fares will increase by no more than 3.75%. Monthly ticket increases will not exceed $15.00. Intermediate monthly and weekly ticket increases are also capped at 3.75%. Some one-way fares will have larger increases only because fares must occur in 25-cent increments. For these one-way fares, any increase greater than 6 percent would be not more than 50 cents per ride. Monthly/Weekly UniTicket Fares will increase by approximately 4.0%. PLEASE NOTE: The March 19 fare increase does not affect ticket prices for travel between stations in Connecticut and New York, or between stations within Connecticut The MTA's continued discipline in keeping costs down has resulted in the lowest increase since 2009. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/new_fares.html

New Fares Effective March 19 for New York State Stations

On Sunday, March 19, new fares will go into effect on the Harlem and Hudson Lines, as well as on the New Haven Line for travel between stations in New York State ONLY. Look for the following specific changes: For monthly and weekly commuters, fares will increase by no more than 3.75%. Monthly ticket increases will not exceed $15.00. Intermediate monthly and weekly ticket increases are also capped at 3.75%. Some one-way fares will have larger increases only because fares must occur in 25-cent increments. For these one-way fares, any increase greater than 6 percent would be not more than 50 cents per ride. Monthly/Weekly UniTicket Fares will increase by approximately 4.0%. PLEASE NOTE: The March 19 fare increase does not affect ticket prices for travel between stations in Connecticut and New York, or between stations within Connecticut The MTA's continued discipline in keeping costs down has resulted in the lowest increase since 2009. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/new_fares.html

Reminder: New Fares Take Effect Sun. March 19

New LIRR fares take effect tomorrow. Most fares will increase 3.75% or less, with the change to monthly tickets capped at $15.00. This will affect monthly tickets for April 2017 (available for purchase starting March 20) and weekly tickets for March 25 - March 31 (available for purchase starting March 22). For details, see attached link.

New Fares Effective March 19 for New York State Stations

On Sunday, March 19, new fares will go into effect on the Harlem and Hudson Lines, as well as on the New Haven Line for travel between stations in New York State ONLY. Look for the following specific changes: For monthly and weekly commuters, fares will increase by no more than 3.75%. Monthly ticket increases will not exceed $15.00. Intermediate monthly and weekly ticket increases are also capped at 3.75%. Some one-way fares will have larger increases only because fares must occur in 25-cent increments. For these one-way fares, any increase greater than 6 percent would be not more than 50 cents per ride. Monthly/Weekly UniTicket Fares will increase by approximately 4.0%. PLEASE NOTE: The March 19 fare increase does not affect ticket prices for travel between stations in Connecticut and New York, or between stations within Connecticut The MTA's continued discipline in keeping costs down has resulted in the lowest increase since 2009. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/new_fares.html

Alcoholic Beverages Not Permitted on Trains, Platforms or at Stations on Saint Patrick's Day

On Saint Patrick's Day, Friday, March 17, Metro-North will not permit alcoholic beverages on trains, platforms or at stations to maintain orderly travel for customers. Any alcoholic beverages found by MTA Police will be confiscated. Customers should buy tickets in advance. We recommend using MTA eTix, (http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo) the mobile ticketing app that lets you purchase and use Metro-North Railroad tickets directly on your smartphone or mobile device. See details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/stpat17.html

Z Line - Weekday Planned Service Change

All times until Summer 2017 Manhattan-bound Z trains skip 121 St and 104 St, due to station rehabilitation. To these stations, use the nearby 111 St or Woodhaven Blvd stations instead. Or, take the Manhattan-bound J to 111 St or Woodhaven Blvd and transfer to a Jamaica Center-bound J. From these stations, use the nearby 111 St or Woodhaven Blvd stations instead. Or, take the Q56 bus and transfer to/from J service at nearby 111 St or Woodhaven Blvd. Note: Jamaica Center-bound J trains skip 104 St and 121 St from 5:30 PM to 6:30 PM, weekdays; take a Q56 bus or the Z instead.

New Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Line Fares Effective March 19, 2017

On Sunday, March 19 new fares will go into effect for all Metro-North stations in New York State on the Pascack Valley and Port Jervis lines. Look for the following changes: The vast majority of fares will increase by approximately 2.0% or less. For monthly and weekly commuters, all fares to/from Hoboken or Penn Station-NY will increase by no more than 2.3%. New Fares Effective March 19 for New York State Stations

On Sunday, March 19, new fares will go into effect on the Harlem and Hudson Lines, as well as on the New Haven Line for travel between stations in New York State ONLY. Look for the following specific changes: For monthly and weekly commuters, fares will increase by no more than 3.75%. Monthly ticket increases will not exceed $15.00. Intermediate monthly and weekly ticket increases are also capped at 3.75%. Some one-way fares will have larger increases only because fares must occur in 25-cent increments. For these one-way fares, any increase greater than 6 percent would be not more than 50 cents per ride. Monthly/Weekly UniTicket Fares will increase by approximately 4.0%. PLEASE NOTE: The March 19 fare increase does not affect ticket prices for travel between stations in Connecticut and New York, or between stations within Connecticut The MTA's continued discipline in keeping costs down has resulted in the lowest increase since 2009. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/new_fares.html

Alcoholic Beverages Not Permitted on Trains, Platforms or at Stations on Saint Patrick's Day

On Saint Patrick's Day, Friday, March 17, Metro-North will not permit alcoholic beverages on trains, platforms or at stations to maintain orderly travel for customers. Any alcoholic beverages found by MTA Police will be confiscated. Customers should buy round-trip tickets in advance at their home stations using ticket machines and ticket offices. We recommend using MTA eTix, (http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo) the mobile ticketing app that lets you purchase and use Metro-North Railroad tickets directly on your smartphone or mobile device. See details at http://tinyurl.com/glaoxw8

Alcoholic Beverages Not Permitted on Trains, Platforms or at Stations on Saint Patrick's Day

On Saint Patrick's Day, Friday, March 17, Metro-North will not permit alcoholic beverages on trains, platforms or at stations to maintain orderly travel for customers. Any alcoholic beverages found by MTA Police will be confiscated. For those heading to the Saint Patrick's Day Parade on the Hudson Line, an extra train will depart from Poughkeepsie at 7:52 AM and stop at New Hamburg at 8:02 AM and Beacon at 8:10 AM before running express to Harlem-125th Street and arriving at Grand Central Terminal at 9:32 AM. Customers should buy round-trip tickets in advance. To ensure order aboard and to assure that fares are collected, conductors will be posted at Poughkeepsie, New Hamburg and Beacon to collect tickets before customers board trains. We recommend using MTA eTix, (http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo) the mobile ticketing app that lets you purchase and use Metro-North Railroad tickets directly on your smartphone or mobile device. See details at http://tinyurl.com/glaoxw8

New Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Line Fares Effective March 19, 2017

On Sunday, March 19 new fares will go into effect for all Metro-North stations in New York State on the Pascack Valley and Port Jervis lines. Look for the following changes: The vast majority of fares will increase by approximately 2.0% or less. For monthly and weekly commuters, all fares to/from Hoboken or Penn Station-NY will increase by no more than 2.3%. See details at http://bit.ly/2lnq5wn The MTA's continued discipline in keeping costs down has resulted in the lowest increase since 2009, when the MTA committed to a biennial schedule to keep adjustments as small and predictable as possible.
New Fares Effective March 19 for New York State Stations

On Sunday, March 19, new fares will go into effect on the Harlem and Hudson Lines, as well as on the New Haven Line for travel between stations in New York State ONLY. Look for the following specific changes: For monthly and weekly commuters, fares will increase by no more than 3.75%. Monthly ticket increases will not exceed $15.00. Intermediate monthly and weekly ticket increases are also capped at 3.75%. Some one-way fares will have larger increases only because fares must occur in 25-cent increments. For these one-way fares, any increase greater than 6 percent would be not more than 50 cents per ride. Monthly/Weekly UniTicket Fares will increase by approximately 4.0%. PLEASE NOTE: The March 19 fare increase does not affect ticket prices for travel between stations in Connecticut and New York, or between stations within Connecticut The MTA's continued discipline in keeping costs down has resulted in the lowest increase since 2009. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/new_fares.html

Alcoholic Beverages Not Permitted on Trains, Platforms or at Stations on Saint Patrick's Day

On Saint Patrick's Day, Friday, March 17, Metro-North will not permit alcoholic beverages on trains, platforms or at stations to maintain orderly travel for customers. Any alcoholic beverages found by MTA Police will be confiscated. Customers should buy round-trip tickets in advance at their home stations using ticket machines and ticket offices. We recommend using MTA eTix, (http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo) the mobile ticketing app that lets you purchase and use Metro-North Railroad tickets directly on your smartphone or mobile device. On Saint Patrick's Day, Friday, March 17, Metro-North will not permit alcoholic beverages on trains, platforms or at stations to maintain orderly travel for customers. Any alcoholic beverages found by MTA Police will be confiscated. For those heading to the Saint Patrick's Day Parade on the Hudson Line, an extra train will depart from Poughkeepsie at 7:52 AM and stop at New Hamburg at 8:02 AM and Beacon at 8:10 AM before running express to Harlem-125th Street and arriving at Grand Central Terminal at 9:32 AM. Customers should buy round-trip tickets in advance. To ensure order aboard and to assure that fares are collected, conductors will be posted at Poughkeepsie, New Hamburg and Beacon to collect tickets before customers board trains. We recommend using MTA eTix, (http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo) the mobile ticketing app that lets you purchase and use Metro-North Railroad tickets directly on your smartphone or mobile device. See details at http://bit.ly/2mBpyGB

Metro-North will suspend train service into and out of Grand Central Terminal at noon due to the anticipated impact of the blizzard on our territory and low ridership during the AM peak. Last trains will depart their originating terminals starting at 9:30 AM and arrive in Grand Central and at their final outlying destinations by noon. No trains will operate after that time until further notice. Please continue to check http://alert.mta.info/ for updates and to listen to local news for updates as to when Metro-North will be able to resume service. View: http://n.v12.net/m?62F30

Winter Storm Update: Service Suspended at Noon

Metro-North will suspend train service into and out of Grand Central Terminal at noon due to the anticipated impact of the blizzard on our territory and low ridership during the AM peak. Last trains will depart their originating terminals starting at 9:30 AM and arrive in Grand Central and at their final outlying destinations by noon. No trains will operate after that time until further notice. Last Hudson Line trains Inbound: 10 AM from Croton-Harmon; Train service was suspended South from Poughkeepsie to Croton Harmon after the 7:50 AM train from Poughkeepsie Outbound: 9:43 AM to Poughkeepsie; 10:21 AM to Croton-Harmon Last Harlem Line trains Inbound: 10:12 AM from Southeast; 10:06 AM from North White Plains Outbound: 9:52 AM to Southeast; 10:25 AM to North White Plains Last New Haven Line trains Inbound: 9:46 AM from New Haven; 10:02 AM from Stamford Outbound: 10:02 to New Haven; 10:36 AM to Stamford This suspension is necessary to ensure the safety of our customers and to enable us to resume service once the worst of the blizzard passes. Please continue to check http://alert.mta.info/ for updates and to listen to local news for updates as to when Metro-North will be able to resume service.

Winter Storm Service Advisory: Sunday Schedule in Effect

Winter Storm Service Advisory: Sunday Schedule in Effect Metro-North will operate a Sunday schedule with extra trains as required on Tuesday, March 14 due to the impact of Winter Storm Stella on our service territory. See our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm for train times. There will be no Branch Line Service provided. (Wassaic to Southeast, Danbury to South Norwalk, New Canaan to Stamford, Waterbury to Bridgeport.) The Haverstraw-Ossining and Newburgh-Beacon ferries, the Hudson Rail Link and reverse peak busing at Philipse Manor and Scarborough will not operate. Please use caution if you must travel during the blizzard. Customers are encouraged to frequently check http://alert.mta.info/ for the latest travel information and to listen for station announcements, as we may need to adjust our service further depending upon the intensity of the storm. West-of-Hudson customers should check www.njtransit.com for details on Port Jervis/Pascack Valley Line service.

Customers are encouraged to check www.mta.info for service change updates and to sign up for custom email or text notifications at www.myMTAalerts.com. Access-A-Ride paratransit service is cancelled during Tuesday's storm, except for emergencies.

Z Line - Weekday Planned Service Change

All times until Summer 2017 Manhattan-bound Z trains skip 121 St, due to station rehabilitation. To this station, use the nearby 111 St station instead. Or, take the Manhattan-bound J to 111 St and transfer to a Jamaica Center-bound J. From this station, use the nearby 111 St station instead. Or, take the Q56 bus and transfer to/from J service at nearby 111 St. Note: Jamaica Center-bound J trains skip 121 St from 5:30 PM to 6:30 PM, weekdays; take a Q56 bus or the Z instead.

L Canarsie Tunnel Reconstruction Public Workshops

March 1, 2017 Dear Subscriber: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) and the New York City Department of Transportation (NYCDOT) held two public workshops to discuss possible travel alternatives to L subway service in preparation for the 2019 closure of the Canarsie Tunnel. Two more workshops are scheduled. Input from the meetings will inform the ongoing studies and traffic modeling exercises. Last Thursday, customers gathered at Our Lady of Guadalupe, and, the week before that, at the Williamsburg High School for Architecture & Design to hear presentations, discuss service options, and provide feedback to officials from the MTA and NYCDOT. Participants engaged in interactive discussions about how they currently use the transit system and how their trips may change during the closure. Information received at the workshops will be considered as representatives develop alternative service plans for when the tunnel is closed for reconstruction. We welcome your participation in the two remaining workshops: East Williamsburg 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM Thursday, March 2, 2017 Progress High School 850 Grand Street, Brooklyn, NY 11211 Manhattan Eastside 7:00 PM - 9:00 PM Thursday, March 9, 2017 Town and Village Synagogue 334 East 14th Street, NY, NY 10003 We'll keep you updated on important project milestones and our planning as the process moves forward. We invite you to view new pages on the MTA website at: http://web.mta.info/sandy/PlanningServiceAlternatives.htm Thank you, L Line Canarsie Tunnel Reconstruction Project Team
